trans-unit.source: Move data to and from Azure Blob | Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data to and from Azure Blob | Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Learn how to move data to/from Azure Blob Storage using Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Learn how to move data to/from Azure Blob Storage using Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to Azure Blob from another data store and move data from another data store to Azure Blob.
trans-unit.target: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to Azure Blob from another data store and move data from another data store to Azure Blob.

trans-unit.source: This article builds on the <linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title> article which presents a general overview of data movement with the copy activity and the supported data store combinations.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on the <linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title> article which presents a general overview of data movement with the copy activity and the supported data store combinations.

trans-unit.source: A <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with a Copy activity that uses <linkText>BlobSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>SqlSink</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with a Copy activity that uses <linkText>BlobSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>SqlSink</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from an Azure blob to a table in an Azure SQL database every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from an Azure blob to a table in an Azure SQL database every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.

trans-unit.source: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: You should create the table in your Azure SQL database with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.
trans-unit.target: You should create the table in your Azure SQL database with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.

trans-unit.source: New rows are added to the table every hour.
trans-unit.target: New rows are added to the table every hour.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to BlobSource and sink type is set to SqlSink.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to BlobSource and sink type is set to SqlSink.

trans-unit.source: A <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with Copy activity that uses <linkText>SqlSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with Copy activity that uses <linkText>SqlSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from a table in Azure SQL database to a blob every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from a table in Azure SQL database to a blob every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in Azure SQL and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.
trans-unit.target: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in Azure SQL and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.

trans-unit.source: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy informs the Azure Data Factory service that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy informs the Azure Data Factory service that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to SqlSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to SqlSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.

trans-unit.source: The SQL query specified for the SqlReaderQuery property selects the data in the past hour to copy.
trans-unit.target: The SQL query specified for the SqlReaderQuery property selects the data in the past hour to copy.

trans-unit.source: You can link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory using an Azure Storage linked service.
trans-unit.target: You can link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory using an Azure Storage linked service.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage linked service.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage linked service.

trans-unit.source: The type property must be set to: AzureStorage
trans-unit.target: The type property must be set to: AzureStorage

trans-unit.source: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.
trans-unit.target: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.

trans-unit.source: You can get the connectionString for the Azure storage from the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the connectionString for the Azure storage from the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of JSON sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the <linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).
trans-unit.target: For a full list of JSON sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the <linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location, format etc. of the data in the data store.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location, format etc. of the data in the data store.

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section for dataset of type AzureBlob dataset has the following properties.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section for dataset of type AzureBlob dataset has the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Path to the container and folder in the blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Path to the container and folder in the blob storage.

trans-unit.source:
Name of the blob. fileName is optional.

If you specify a filename, the activity (including Copy) works on the specific Blob.

When fileName is not specified Copy will include all Blobs in the folderPath for input dataset.

When fileName is not specified for an output dataset, the name of the generated file would be in the following this format: Data..txt (for example: : Data.0a405f8a-93ff-4c6f-b3be-f69616f1df7a.txt
trans-unit.target:
Name of the blob. fileName is optional.

If you specify a filename, the activity (including Copy) works on the specific Blob.

When fileName is not specified Copy will include all Blobs in the folderPath for input dataset.

When fileName is not specified for an output dataset, the name of the generated file would be in the following this format: Data..txt (for example: : Data.0a405f8a-93ff-4c6f-b3be-f69616f1df7a.txt

trans-unit.source: You can use it to specify a dynamic folderPath and filename for time series data.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to specify a dynamic folderPath and filename for time series data.

trans-unit.source: For example, folderPath can be parameterized for every hour of data.
trans-unit.target: For example, folderPath can be parameterized for every hour of data.

trans-unit.source: See the Leverage partitionedBy prperty section below for details and examples.
trans-unit.target: See the Leverage partitionedBy prperty section below for details and examples.

trans-unit.source: You need to set the type property under format to either of these values.
trans-unit.target: You need to set the type property under format to either of these values.

trans-unit.source: When the format is TextFormat you can specify additional optional properties for format.
trans-unit.target: When the format is TextFormat you can specify additional optional properties for format.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Specifying TextFormat</linkText><title></title> section below for more details.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Specifying TextFormat</linkText><title></title> section below for more details.

trans-unit.source: Specify the type and level of compression for the data.
trans-unit.target: Specify the type and level of compression for the data.

trans-unit.source: Supported types are: GZip, Deflate, and BZip2 and supported levels are: Optimal and Fastest.
trans-unit.target: Supported types are: GZip, Deflate, and BZip2 and supported levels are: Optimal and Fastest.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Compression support</linkText><title></title> section for more details.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Compression support</linkText><title></title> section for more details.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned above, you can specify a dynamic folderPath and filename for time series data with the partitionedBy section, Data Factory macros and the system variables: SliceStart and SliceEnd, which indicate start and end times for a given data slice.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned above, you can specify a dynamic folderPath and filename for time series data with the partitionedBy section, Data Factory macros and the system variables: SliceStart and SliceEnd, which indicate start and end times for a given data slice.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Creating Datasets</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Scheduling & Execution</linkText><title></title> articles to understand more details on time series datasets, scheduling and slices.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Creating Datasets</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Scheduling & Execution</linkText><title></title> articles to understand more details on time series datasets, scheduling and slices.

trans-unit.source: In the above example {Slice} is replaced with the value of Data Factory system variable SliceStart in the format (YYYYMMDDHH) specified.
trans-unit.target: In the above example {Slice} is replaced with the value of Data Factory system variable SliceStart in the format (YYYYMMDDHH) specified.

trans-unit.source: The SliceStart refers to start time of the slice.
trans-unit.target: The SliceStart refers to start time of the slice.

trans-unit.source: The folderPath is different for each slice.
trans-unit.target: The folderPath is different for each slice.

trans-unit.source: In the above example, year, month, day, and time of SliceStart are extracted into separate variables that are used by folderPath and fileName properties.
trans-unit.target: In the above example, year, month, day, and time of SliceStart are extracted into separate variables that are used by folderPath and fileName properties.

trans-unit.source: If the format is set to TextFormat, you can specify the following optional properties in the Format section.
trans-unit.target: If the format is set to TextFormat, you can specify the following optional properties in the Format section.

trans-unit.source: The character(s) used as a column separator in a file.This tag is optional.
trans-unit.target: The character(s) used as a column separator in a file.This tag is optional.

trans-unit.source: The character(s) used as a raw separator in file.
trans-unit.target: The character(s) used as a raw separator in file.

trans-unit.source: The default value is any of the following: [“\r\n”, “\r”,” \n”].
trans-unit.target: The default value is any of the following: [“\r\n”, “\r”,” \n”].

trans-unit.source:
The special character used to escape column delimiter shown in content. This tag is optional. No default value. You must specify no more than one character for this property.

For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: “Hello, world”), you can define ‘$’ as the escape character and use string “Hello$, world” in the source.

Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.
trans-unit.target:
The special character used to escape column delimiter shown in content. This tag is optional. No default value. You must specify no more than one character for this property.

For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: “Hello, world”), you can define ‘$’ as the escape character and use string “Hello$, world” in the source.

Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.

trans-unit.source:
The special character is used to quote the string value. The column and row delimiters inside of the quote characters would be treated as part of the string value. This tag is optional. No default value. You must specify no more than one character for this property.

For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: ), you can define ‘"’ as the quote character and use string <"Hello, world"> in the source. This property is applicable to both input and output tables.

Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.
trans-unit.target:
The special character is used to quote the string value. The column and row delimiters inside of the quote characters would be treated as part of the string value. This tag is optional. No default value. You must specify no more than one character for this property.

For example, if you have comma (,) as the column delimiter but you want have comma character in the text (example: ), you can define ‘"’ as the quote character and use string <"Hello, world"> in the source. This property is applicable to both input and output tables.

Note that you cannot specify both escapeChar and quoteChar for a table.

trans-unit.source:
The character(s) used to represent null value in blob file content. This tag is optional. The default value is “\N”.

For example, based on above sample, “NaN” in blob will be translated as null value while copied into e.g. SQL Server.
trans-unit.target:
The character(s) used to represent null value in blob file content. This tag is optional. The default value is “\N”.

For example, based on above sample, “NaN” in blob will be translated as null value while copied into e.g. SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: For the list of valid encoding names, see: <linkText>Encoding.EncodingName Property</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the list of valid encoding names, see: <linkText>Encoding.EncodingName Property</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following sample shows some of the format properties for TextFormat.
trans-unit.target: The following sample shows some of the format properties for TextFormat.

trans-unit.source: To use an escapeChar instead of quoteChar, replace the line with quoteChar with the following:
trans-unit.target: To use an escapeChar instead of quoteChar, replace the line with quoteChar with the following:

trans-unit.source: If the format is set to AvroFormat, you do not need to specify any properties in the Format section within the typeProperties section.
trans-unit.target: If the format is set to AvroFormat, you do not need to specify any properties in the Format section within the typeProperties section.

trans-unit.source: To use Avro format in a Hive table, you can refer to <linkText>Apache Hive’s tutorial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To use Avro format in a Hive table, you can refer to <linkText>Apache Hive’s tutorial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the <linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the <linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.

trans-unit.source: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks
trans-unit.target: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks

trans-unit.source: BlobSource supports the following properties in the typeProperties section:
trans-unit.target: BlobSource supports the following properties in the typeProperties section:

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to treat null or empty string as null value.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to treat null or empty string as null value.

trans-unit.source: Indicate how many lines need be skipped.
trans-unit.target: Indicate how many lines need be skipped.

trans-unit.source: It is applicable only when input dataset is using TextFormat.
trans-unit.target: It is applicable only when input dataset is using TextFormat.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to add header of column definitions.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to add header of column definitions.
